operations.summary: Create a pending order for certificate
operations.notes: Creating a certificate order can be a long running asynchronous operation in the PKI workflow. The PKI API supports 2 options for getting the completion stateful actions for this asynchronous operations: 1) by polling operations -- see /v1/certificates/{certificateId}/actions 2) via WebHook style callback -- see '/v1/certificates/{certificateId}/callback'.

parameters.name: X-Market-Id
parameters.description: Setting locale for communications such as emails and error messages

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access
Certificate state does not allow renew

notes: This method is used to obtain the site seal information for an issued certificate.
A site seal is a graphic that the certificate purchaser can embed on their web site to show
their visitors information about their SSL certificate. If a web site visitor clicks on the
site seal image, a pop-up page is displayed that contains detailed information about the SSL
certificate. The site seal token is used to link the site seal graphic image to the appropriate
certificate details pop-up page display when a user clicks on the site seal. The site seal
images are expected to be static images and hosted on the reseller's website, to minimize
delays for customer page load times.

parameters.name: theme
parameters.description: This value represents the visual theme of the seal. If seal doesn't exist, default values are used if params not present. If seal does exist, default values will not be used to update unless params present.

parameters.name: locale
parameters.description: Determine locale for text displayed in seal image and verification page. If seal doesn't exist, default values are used if params not present. If seal does exist, default values will not be used to update unless params present.

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access
Certificate state does not allow seal

operations.notes: Once the certificate order has been created, this method can be used to check the status of the certificate. This method can also be used to retrieve details of the certificate.

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access

operations.notes: Domain control is a means for verifying the domain included in the certificate order. This resource is useful for resellers that control the domains for their customers, and can expedite the verification process. See https://www.godaddy.com/help/verifying-your-domain-ownership-for-ssl-certificate-requests-html-or-dns-7452

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access
Certificate state does not allow domain control

notes: Rekeying is the process by which the private and public key is changed for a certificate.
It is a simplified reissue,where only the CSR is changed. Reissuing is the process by which domain
names are added or removed from a certificate.Once a request is validated and approved, the certificate
will be reissued with the new common name and sans specified. Unlimited reissues are available during the
lifetime of the certificate.New names added to a certificate that do not share the base domain of the
common name may take additional time to validate. If this API call is made before a previous pending
reissue has been validated and issued, the previous reissue request is automatically rejected and replaced
with the current request.

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access
Certificate state does not allow reissue

notes: Renewal is the process by which the validity of a certificate is extended.
Renewal is only available 60 days prior to expiration of the previous certificate and 30 days after the expiration of the previous certificate.
The renewal supports modifying a set of the original certificate order information. Once a request is validated and approved, the certificate
will be issued with extended validity. Since subject alternative names can be removed during a renewal, we
require that you provide the subject alternative names you expect in the renewed certificate. New names added to a certificate that do not share the base domain of the
common name may take additional time to validate.

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access
Certificate state does not allow renew

operations.notes: This method is used to register/replace url for callbacks for stateful actions relating to a certificate lifecycle. The callback url is a Webhook style pattern and will receive POST http requests with json body defined in the CertificateAction model definition for each certificate action.  Only one callback URL is allowed to be registered for each certificateId, so it will replace a previous registration.

parameters.name: certificateId
parameters.description: Certificate id to register/replace for callback

parameters.name: callbackUrl
parameters.description: Callback url registered/replaced to receive stateful actions

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access

operations.summary: Retrieve system stateful action callback url
operations.notes: This method is used to retrieve the registered callback url for a certificate.

parameters.description: Certificate id to register for stateful action callback

responseMessages.message: Authentication info not sent or invalid
Authenticated user is not allowed access

operations.notes: Unregister the callback for a particular certificate.

subjectAlternativeNames.description: Only used for UCC products. An array of subject alternative names to include in certificate.

rootType.description: Root Type. Depending on certificate expiration date, SHA_1 not be allowed. Will default to SHA_2 if expiration date exceeds sha1 allowed date

callbackUrl.description: Required if client would like to receive stateful action via callback during certificate lifecyle

commonName.description: The common name of certificate to be secured

delayExistingRevoke.description: In hours, time to delay revoking existing certificate after issuance of new certificate. If revokeExistingCertOnIssuance is enabled, this value will be ignored

subjectAlternativeNames.description: Only used for UCC products. An array of subject alternative names to include in certificate. Not including a subject alternative name that was in the previous certificate will remove it from the renewed certificate.

period.description: Number of years for certificate validity period, if different from previous certificate

rootType.description: Root Type. Depending on certificate expiration date, SHA_1 not be allowed. Will default to SHA_2 if expiration date exceeds sha1 allowed date

callbackUrl.description: Required if client would like to receive stateful actions via callback during certificate lifecyle

commonName.description: The common name of certificate to be secured

productType.description: Type of product requesting a certificate. Only required non-renewal

period.description: Number of years for certificate validity period

commonName.description: Name to be secured in certificate. If provided, CN field in CSR will be ignored.

subjectAlternativeNames.description: Subject Alternative names. Collection of subjectAlternativeNames to be included in certificate.

slotSize.description: Number of subject alternative names(SAN) to be included in certificate

callbackUrl.description: Required if client would like to receive stateful actions via callback during certificate lifecyle

rootType.description: Root Type. Depending on certificate expiration date, SHA_1 not be allowed. Will default to SHA_2 if expiration date exceeds sha1 allowed date

organization.description: Required for EVSSL, OVSSL, CS, and DS

name.description: Name of organization that owns common name

assumedName.description: Only for EVSSL. The DBA(does business as) name for the organization.

name.description: Name of organization that owns common name

assumedName.description: Only for EVSSL. The DBA(does business as) name for the organization.

country.description: Two character country code of organization

state.description: Full name of State/Province/Territory of organization address

jobTitle.description: Only used for EVSSL. Job title of requestor contact

certificateId.description: The unique identifier of the certificate request. Only present if verified.

certificate.description: End entity certificate in PEM format

intermediate.description: CA Signing Intermediate certificate in PEM format

root.description: CA Root certificate in PEM format

cross.description: CA Cross Intermediate certificate in PEM format

certificateId.description: The unique identifier of the certificate request. Only present if no errors returned

period.description: Validity period of order. Specified in years

validStart.description: The start date of the certificate's validity (if issued or revoked).

validEnd.description: The end date of the certificate's validity (if issued or revoked).

createdAt.description: The date the certificate was ordered.

serialNumber.description: Serial number of certificate (if issued or revoked)

serialNumberHex.description: Hexadecmial format for Serial number of certificate(if issued or revoked)

revokedAt.description: The revocation date of certificate (if revoked).

slotSize.description: Number of subject alternative names(SAN) to be included in certificate

deniedReason.description: Only present if certificate order has been denied

progress.description: Percentage of completion for certificate vetting

subjectAlternativeName.description: Subject alternative name to be included in certificate

callbackUrl.description: Callback url registered to receive stateful actions

path.description: JSONPath referring to the field within the submitted data containing an error

code.description: Short identifier for the error, suitable for indicating the specific error within client code

message.description: Description of the problem with the contents of the field

code.description: Short identifier for the error, suitable for indicating the specific error within client code

fields.description: List of the specific fields, and the errors found with their contents
